The geographically impossible claim: The website meaww.com claimed that the photograph was geographically impossible as the Eiffel Tower and Notre Dame Cathedral are located far from each other and cannot be captured in the same shot from that angle. This aspect was employed to question the authenticity of the claim.
Photographer: s explanation: A.G. Photographe, the photographer who captured the image, explained on Facebook that the photograph was taken from Vincennes with a Nikon D850 and a 600mm Sigma telephoto lens. This aspect was used to verify the authenticity of the claim by providing the technical details of the equipment used.
Telephoto lens compression: The use of a large telephoto lens by A.G. Photographe was mentioned to explain why the Eiffel Tower and Notre Dame Cathedral appeared closer together in the photograph than they actually are in reality. This aspect was employed to clarify the optical effect of a telephoto lens on distances and verify the authenticity of the claim.
Additional photographs by A: G. Photographe: It was mentioned that A.G. Photographe took multiple photographs of the Notre Dame fire, including another one showing the Eiffel Tower. This aspect was employed to support the authenticity of the claim by providing additional evidence from the same photographer.
